titles.title: To establish designations for United States Postal Service buildings located in Coconut Grove, Opa Locka, Carol City, and Miami, Florida.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Motion to Report Measure Defeated by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Mr. McHugh moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/9/1998--Passed House amended. Designates the U.S. Postal Service buildings located at: (1) 3191 Grand Avenue in Coconut Grove, Florida, as the William R. "Billy" Rolle Post Office Building; (2) 550 Fisherman Street in Opa Locka, Florida, as the Helen Miller Post Office Building; (3) 18690 N.W. 37th Avenue in Carol City, Florida, as the Essie Silva Post Office Building; (4) 500 North West 2nd Avenue in Miami, Florida, as the Athalie Range Post Office Building; and (5) 995 North West 119th Street in Miami, Florida, as the Garth Reeves, Sr. Post Office Building.
